enrichment.FinancialSupport:
TADSS trainees are eligible for bursaries and student loans\r
[Read more at ](http://www.exeter.ac.uk/students/finance/studentfunding/fundingforpgcestudents/)
enrichment.InterviewProcess:
If an applicant is invited to attend one of our assessment days, they will be notified by email and letter with details of the assessment process. \r
 Usually, the assessment sessions are held in one of our partner schools.  \r
\r
There are 3 elements to the assessment day:\r
\r
* plan and deliver a short activity with a group of children (usually 6 - 8 pupils of mixed ability)\r
* a reflective written activity on an aspect of teaching and learning\r
* an interview with a representative from TADSS and the head teacher of the hosting school\r
\r
The offer of a place is made to the applicant through UCAS by the University of Exeter.  Places are often conditional as some applicants may be completing degrees or relevant qualifications.  Also, all applicants must pass the professional skills tests, complete a confidential medical questionnaire to ensure they are fit to teach and that Disclosure and Barring Services checks have been made.

inst.TrainWithUs:
TADSS ITT Partnership is a group of nearly forty first, primary and special schools across Dorset.  We have a 100% completion success rate and all 2018/19 trainees are employed in Dorset schools.\r
\r
Our teacher training programme combines:\r
\r
* school based practice and reflection\r
* academic on-line learning\r
* face to face training events.  \r
\r
Our wide partnership gives opportunities to gain experience in coastal, rural or urban school settings, with trainees predominately placed within thirty minutes of home.  Trainees can express a preference for placements in both mainstream and special schools. \r
\r
We offer places for Primary phase teacher training in Dorset through the School Direct route into teaching.  This means our trainees are mainly school based during their training year.   The intensive and immersive classroom experience helps to build teaching skills, supported by an experienced classroom teacher and in-school mentor. \r
\r
Alongside the practical experience, our trainees regularly come together for our taught programme:\r
\r
* An intensive 15 day programme, covering all aspects of the curriculum and teaching \r
* A strong emphasis on understanding special educational needs and positive behaviour management\r
* Designed and led by outstanding school practitioners, giving trainee teachers practical training and advice based on classroom experience\r
\r
In addition, our trainees are students of the University of Exeter who award Qualified Teacher Status and the Post Graduate Certificate of Education to trainees on successful completion of the training year.  Trainees are allocated a day each week for their academic studies with the university, studying at home or in school.
inst.TrainWithDisability:
We work with with trainee as an individual in order to ensure they can access the programme and are effectively supported in school, whatever their needs.  The trainees progress in school at their own pace.  \r
\r
Academically, support is available from teh unvirsity through their wellbeing service.  Further details can be found using this link (https://www.exeter.ac.uk/wellbeing/accessability/)

AccreditingProviderEnrichments.Description:
We partner with the University of Exeter to provide the School Direct fee paying distance learning programme.  The university's teacher training provision was inspected by OFSTED in 2017 and was again judged an  Outstanding Provider. \r
\r
Our trainees go to the university campus in Exeter for 1 day to familiarise themselves with the model of training and the online learning tool they will use for their academic study.  Each term, they are visited in school  by their Exeter tutor. \r
\r
[University of Exeter website](https://www.exeter.ac.uk/teachertraining/schooldirect/)
